entry.title: How can the field BSEG-ZBD1T be made visible again for use in a substitution in SAP S/4HANA?

While creating a substitution in SAP S/4HANA (Transaction OBBH), I have noticed that the field BSEG-ZBD1T (Cash Discount Days 1) or BSEG-ZBD2T (Cash Discount Days 2) do not appear in the list of available fields for substitution entries.

Are you aware of any solution or known workaround that would allow this field to be used in a substitution?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Kind regards,

entry.title: How do i change the status of MT940 to red
entry.content:
I have run MT940 and all lines were red. Some subledger postings were completed and posted but no bank postings were completed. I ran RFEBKA90 but this changed the status to posted. How do I revert this?

My thoughts are

1, Reverse the subledger postings.

2. Delete the statement

3. Re-run the bank statement upload

 

Any ideas?

entry.title: Manual Bank Statement Processing with Unknown Bank Charges ‚Äì Need for Flexible Clearing Logic
entry.content:
Description:

Dear SAP Support,

We are facing a challenge during manual bank statement processing in SAP S/4HANA (FICO module). In our business scenario, we receive customer payments against invoices‚Äîfor example, an invoice of 1000. At the time of receiving the payment (before the actual bank deposit), we post the following entry: Debit Incoming Clearing Account (Temporary) 1000 and Credit Customer Account 1000. However, when the actual bank statement arrives the next day, it shows that only 900 was deposited into our bank account, and the remaining 100 was deducted as bank charges.

 

We want to reflect this correctly in the manual bank statement posting. Specifically, the desired accounting entries during manual bank statement posting should be: (1) Debit Main Bank Account 900 and Credit Technical Clearing Account 900, and (2) Debit Technical Clearing Account 900, Debit Bank Charges 100, and Credit Incoming Clearing Account 1000. This allows us to record the actual bank deposit, account for the bank charges as an expense, and fully clear the Incoming Clearing Account for 1000.

 

Ideally, we want the system to automatically post the difference between the incoming amount (1000) and the bank credited amount (900) to a Bank Charges G/L account during manual bank statement posting. This should happen even when the deducted amount is not known in advance or follows no fixed percentage rule.

 

The issue we are facing is that during manual bank statement posting (‚ÄúManage Incoming Bank Statement‚Äù app in Public Cloud), 

 

Additionally, the major complexity is that we do not know the exact percentage or amount of bank charges in advance. The amount deducted by the bank varies case by case, so it is not feasible to automate this logic using fixed interpretation algorithms or rules. Due to this, we need a flexible mechanism that allows us to manually enter the actual deposit amount, and the system should automatically calculate and post the difference to the Bank Charges account while still clearing the full incoming amount.

Best regards,
Ahsan Ali
SAP FICO Consultant

entry.title: BoE ‚Äì AP: Why Can‚Äôt We Set Maturity Date per Supplier Master ?
entry.content:
Dear expert, 

I‚Äôm reaching out to seek clarification regarding the handling of Bills of Exchange (BoE) due dates (maturity dates) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

Based on our testing and the SAP Knowledge Base Article [2837406 ‚Äì Due Date in Manage Automatic Payments for BOE Outgoing Payments], we understand that the BoE due date can either be manually entered during the automatic payment run or derived from the invoice due date, depending on the configuration setup shown in the KBA above. 

However, in our case, BoE maturity terms (e.g., 45, 60, or 90 days) are typically defined in individual supplier contracts and therefore differ from one vendor to another. As these terms are vendor-specific and contractually agreed, it would be both practical and efficient to maintain the BoE maturity term directly within the supplier master data. Doing so would enable the system to automatically apply the correct maturity during BoE processing, ensuring consistency and minimizing manual input.

Therefore, I would like to understand why SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) does not currently support storing BoE maturity terms per supplier in the supplier master.

I kindly request your support in addressing the following:

  • Could you clarify why the system does not allow BoE maturity terms (e.g., 60 days) to be maintained per supplier?

  • Are there any planned enhancements in this area, or possible workarounds (such as using custom fields or extensibility features)?

  • What are the recommended best practices for handling BoE AP in scenarios where maturity terms are supplier-specific?

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
HY

entry.title: Where are exchange rates actually used in business processes (FI, MM, SD)?

However, I‚Äôm still looking for concrete use cases or documentation that describe how and where the exchange rate is used ‚Äì for example, in sales documents, purchase orders, or billing. I‚Äôd like to include a clear use case for all Moduls in our group-wide rollout showing where exchange rates impact business processes in SAP.

Is there a clear overview, real-life example, or detailed explanation of which transactions or document types rely on exchange rates?

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards,
Simon

entry.title: Intercompany Financial Posting (1GP) - Post General Journal Entry Between Two Company Codes
entry.content:
Hi, Community Members!

I‚Äôd like to ask for your support with an issue I‚Äôm facing in script 1GP at Public Cloud 
The purpose of this activity is to post a general journal entry between two company codes. However, I wasn‚Äôt able to maintain the accountants between my company codes, and the following error occurs:

- - - - - - - - - - -

No accts maintained for company code clearing between comp.cds 30BR and 1410.

Diagnosis

In company code clearing, clearing accounts must be maintained for the affected company codes.

System Response

Company code clearing is required for the posting. You cannot carry out the posting if you have not assigned any clearing accounts.

Procedure

Maintain the clearing accounts.

Message no. F5730

Screenshots regarding the issue: 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

I‚Äôve applied the configurations in CBC as suggested in the script, but unfortunately, the issue persists.

 

Could you please take a look and help me make the necessary adjustments?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Trading Partner within MM Subcontracting Consumption posting
entry.content:
Hello,

we face an issue in MM Subcontracting with an intercompany vendor. We use MM Subcontracting for a type of repair service. We send the broken item with a delivery related to a subcontracting purchase order, the item in the order is the same material number. When we receive the item back, the GR Posting also posts the consumption of the item sent (special stock in sending company) with trading partner. But this item is never owned by the IC vendor. Because of the system behaviour we get in trouble with our consolidation team, since this entry can not be consolidated with the IC vendor, so its a one side trading partner entry.

The propsal of SAP support is an implicit enhancement which we would like to avoid.

Has anybody a standard solution for this topic or maybe a process which does not cause such an issue?

Many thanks in advance!

Regards, Marion

entry.title: SAPFPAYM not triggered automatically after F110 / Manage Automatic Payments
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am facing an issue with Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) in S/4HANA.
When I run F110 (or Manage Automatic Payments), the payment run finishes successfully, payments are posted, and the payment advice notes are generated.

However, the payment medium file (DME) is not automatically created.
I always need to go to SE38 and run SAPFPAYM manually to generate the payment medium file.

In Manage Payment Media, the status of my items is usually "Downloaded", and I cannot change it to "To Be Generated".

Here are additional details:

  • Payment method is correctly assigned to DMEE format (e.g., FI_PAYMEDIUM_DMEE_CGI_05)

  • Program RFFOAVIS_FPAYM is assigned in the "Printout/Data Medium" tab of the payment method

  • In DME Administration (DMEEADMIN), I can see my file with "Data transmitted to external" checked

  • No DME file is found in AL11 unless I manually run SAPFPAYM

My question:

  • How can I configure F110 so that SAPFPAYM is automatically triggered during the payment run, without having to execute it manually?

  • Do I need to adjust the Payment Medium Workbench (PMW) selection variant, or maintain a missing link in the payment method customizing?

  • Could the status "Downloaded" in Manage Payment Media block the automatic generation?

Any advice or guidance on customizing steps to make SAPFPAYM run automatically after F110 would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 1
entry.content:
Introduction:

Hello everyone, Myself Sriram Balaji, I am currently working as an SAP FICO Consultant. Last year, I got an opportunity to work in SAP Public Cloud Greenfield Implementation Project. During the ‚ÄúFIT to Standard‚Äù and ‚ÄúUAT‚Äù sessions, we have demonstrated the SAP standard Customer / Supplier Aging Analysis Report to the client but they are not satisfied with the standard aging report. They required a tailored Aging Analysis Report for Customer and Supplier, one that aligned perfectly with their unique operational requirements. This experience highlighted the importance of understanding client expectations beyond standard functionalities and fueled my journey into customizing SAP solutions in the Public Cloud.

In this blog, we are going to explore how we can develop Customized Customer (AR) Aging Analysis Report using the ‚ÄúKey User Extensibility‚Äù in the SAP Public Cloud.

 

Purpose of Preparing Customer Aging Analysis Report:

Customer Aging Analysis Report, is a basic financial report which provides the information of outstanding payment from the customer‚Äôs and how long they are due for the payment by categorizing into the Aging Buckets (0 ‚Äì 30 Days, 31 ‚Äì 60 Days, ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Above 365 Days).

The aging report provides vital information to management to evaluate how effective the business is at converting sales to cash. The aging report is also used as a tool for estimating potential bad debts, which are then used to revise what is known as the allowance for doubtful accounts.

 

Key-User Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud:

Extensibility covers a broad spectrum of topics that enable customers and partners to adapt standard business software to their business needs.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud key user extensibility allows adapting standard functionalities to user requirements without the need for any external tools. Key User Extensibility is done in the customizing tenant of the development system through SAP Fiori apps designed to facilitate someone making small changes to apps, reports, and email and form templates without any coding experience.

Here's an overview of the things you can do using key user extensibility tools:

  • Change and adapt the UIs for SAP Fiori Apps
  • Create Custom Fields
  • Create your own custom templates or extend the standard forms and email templates
  • Create customer-specific CDS Views
  • Enhance the current business process by creating custom business logic
  • Create a new custom user interface
  • Create custom business objects

SAP S/4HANA embodies key user extensibility tools, which are completely web-based. They are targeted at key users who have a deep knowledge of the product itself, but not necessarily a very deep technical knowledge.

For more details about Extensibility in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud, please refer the link https://extensibilityexplorer.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/ExtensibilityExplorer/#/ReadMore

To develop the Customized Customer Aging Analysis Report, we are going to use the below Key-User Extensibility Apps and other provided Apps by SAP in the Public Cloud:

  • Custom CDS View APP
  • Custom Analytical Queries APP
  • View Browser APP
  • Custom Catalog Extensions APP

My prior experience in developing Aging Analysis Reports in SAP ECC and S/4HANA GUI with my technical team allowed me to apply the same logic to Custom CDS Views and Custom Analytical Queries, even without knowing any deep technical knowledge.

Let me summarize the business requirement for Customer Aging Analysis before jumping into the technical steps involved for the development:

  • The report should display: Customer Account, Customer Name, Document Number, Line Item, Document Type, GL Account, Payment Terms (with descriptions), and other required fields.
  • The report should calculate and present: Overdue Days, Not Yet Due, Aging Buckets (0-30 days, 31-60 days, ‚Ä¶... and Above 365 days), and Total Overdue Amount.
  • The report balances must be matched with the 'Manage Customer Line Items' App (Accounts Receivable Ledger).

 

In this Part - 1, We will explore how we can utilize the Custom CDS View APP for the AR Aging Analysis Report development.

 

Custom CDS View:

Custom CDS views can serve different purposes: They can be consumed in analytics or serve as external APIs to be consumed in external systems, for instance the SAP BTP. Especially Cube or Dimension views can be used in analytical scenarios and also you can create or modify a custom CDS view by,

  • Adding fields from multiple data sources.
  • Creating your own calculated fields.
  • Refining the properties of the selected fields.
  • Creating and maintaining parameters for the usage within your view.

We have combined the multiple data sources such as I_JournalEntryOperationalView, _I_GLAccountText, and _I_PaymentTermsText to create a Custom CDS View by using the Join Condition.

 

Step ‚Äì 1: Open the APP ‚Äì Custom CDS View

Click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù.

 

Enter the ‚ÄúLabel‚Äù, Choose the ‚ÄúScenario‚Äù ‚Äì ‚ÄúAnalytical Cube‚Äù and Click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù Button.

Note: By choosing the Scenario as ‚ÄúAnalytical Cube‚Äù, We can use this CDS View to create an Analytical Queries for the Customer Aging Analysis report.

 

Step ‚Äì 2: Choose the Primary Data Source 

Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù Button

Choose the ‚ÄúPrimary Data Source‚Äù

Note: Data Source is an object containing the key figures and characteristics from the database and it provides a multidimensional analytical view of business data.

 

Select the respective ‚ÄúI_JournalEntryOperationalView‚Äù Data Source from the list.

 

This I_JournalEntryOperationalView CDS view provides access to all details of a journal entry item (database table ACDOCA) joined to the details of the corresponding operational accounting document item (database table BSEG) and to the details of the corresponding journal entry header (database table BKPF) including the most important business entity, such as G/L account, Cost Center or Profit Center.

So, this I_JournalEntryOperationalView is similar to the ACDOCA Table which contains the values of all the relevant fields related to the Accounting Document.

 

Step ‚Äì 3: Choose the Associated Data Sources

Click on ‚ÄúAssociated Data Sources‚Äù

Note: Associated Data Sources will help us to combine the two different data sources into one CDS View by using a join condition set between two or more equal characteristics present in the Primary Data Source ‚Äì A and Associated Date Sources ‚Äì B that contains the same data type.

For Example:

The primary data source "I_JournalEntryOperationalView" does not include the "Payment Terms Description" field. Therefore, we must join it with the associated data source "I_PaymentTermsText" using a join condition to retrieve this field.

Select the ‚ÄúJoin Condition‚Äù Icon.

 

Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù

 

Choose the common field that available in the both Primary & Associated Data Source to join.

 

Select the Value Type as ‚ÄúField‚Äù

Click on F4 in the Value Field.

 

Find the corresponding "Payment Terms" mapping field in the Primary Data Source to link it with the field in the Associated Data Source.

 

Select the Value Type as ‚ÄúSession Variable‚Äù

Choose the Value as ‚ÄúSystem Language‚Äù and Click on ‚ÄúClose‚Äù button.

 

Step ‚Äì 4: Choose the Elements (Fields) to be added in the CDS View

In the Elements Section, Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù button and Choose ‚ÄúElements‚Äù.

In the Elements selection pop up screen,

Choose the ‚ÄúElements (Fields)‚Äù from ‚ÄúI_JournalEntryOperationalView‚Äù you want to display in the CDS view and then Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

Total 142 Elements (Fields) have been selected for the CDS view.

 

Step ‚Äì 5: Create User Defined Parameters

User-Defined Parameters:

Parameters usually require data input when your custom CDS view is executed. This data can then be used like a variable e.g. in filters, calculated fields or even in a join condition to another view. You can then refine them or just create your own parameters if you need them.

The Customer Aging Analysis Report will operate based on "Open Items at Key Date," mirroring the functionality found in reports like "Manage Customer Line Item" or "FBL5N."

The "Open Items at Key Date" logic ensures that when the report is run for a specific date (which can be in the past, present, or future), it will only display items that meet following criteria mentioned below:

  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were not yet cleared as of the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared after the specified key date will be included in the report.
  • The open items (Invoices, Payments, & Advances) were cleared before the specified key date will be excluded from the report.

This "Key Date" will serve as a crucial input on the report's selection screen, driving the logic for determining which open items are included in the Customer Aging Report.

In the Parameters Section, Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù button,

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Data Type: ‚ÄúDATS‚Äù ‚Äì Date (YYYYMMDD Format) Data type of the parameter.
  • Default Type and Value: ‚ÄúManual‚Äù - Enter a manual parameter value in accordance with the data type syntax, e.g. for the data type DATS enter a manual value in the format YYYYMMDD.

Now the ‚ÄúOpen Items at Key Date‚Äù Parameter is created. 

 

Step ‚Äì 6: Add User Defined Parameters in the Elements (Fields)

In the Elements Section, Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù Button and Choose the ‚ÄúParameters‚Äù.

Select the created ‚ÄúOpen Items at Key Date‚Äù Parameter and Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù button.

Now the ‚ÄúOpen Items at Key Date‚Äù Parameter has been added in the Elements.

 

Step ‚Äì 7: Using ‚ÄúFilter‚Äù Applying the Logic for the Customer Aging Analysis Report

You can filter the information shown in your custom CDS view by setting up a condition, just like using the WHERE clause in SQL. This condition provides the view exactly what data to show.

Think of it like this:

The CDS view (I_JournalEntryOperationalView) which we are using that shows all the Accounting Document transactions in line item wise.

  • If you want to display only Customer related Accounting Transactions, you'd set a condition like "Account Type is equal to ‚ÄúD".
  • Or, if you only want to see Normal Transactions (Invoices, Payments) & Special GL Transactions (Advances), your condition would be "Special GL Code equal to ‚ÄúBLANK‚Äù, & ‚ÄúA‚Äù.

Once you set this condition (using either a simple editor or a form-based one), your CDS view will automatically filter its results, showing only the open items that match what you asked for. It's a way to fine-tune the data you see without having to look through everything.

We can use the form-based version to define simple filter conditions. In case you want to define more complex conditions, we can use expression-based version. Here, we have used expression-based version.

As per business requirement, to ensure the Customer Aging Analysis Report balances match with the "Manage Customer Line Items" balances, we've set up specific conditions for these fields: Account Type, Special GL Code, Posting Date, and Clearing Date in the Filter section using expression-based version.

 

Step ‚Äì 8: Create Calculation Elements (Fields) ‚Äì Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days

In the Elements section, click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù button and Choose ‚ÄúCalculation‚Äù to create Overdue Days & Payment Terms Days fields for the report.

  1. Overdue Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as ‚ÄúFunction‚Äù and Choose ‚ÄúFunction Type ‚Äì Date and Time‚Äù
  • Choose the respective ‚ÄúFunction - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN‚Äù and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù.

Note: The function DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN calculates the difference between two specified dates, date1 and date2, in days. The actual parameters must have the predefined data type DATS and should contain a valid date in the format YYYYMMDD.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Overdue Days is Open Items Key Date (which was created as parameter for report execution) MINUS Net Due Date. 

 

  1. Payment Terms Days

Enter the following information:

  • Name: Technical Name
  • Label: Name to be displayed in the output of the parameter
  • Choose as ‚ÄúFunction‚Äù and Choose ‚ÄúFunction Type ‚Äì Date and Time‚Äù
  • Choose the respective ‚ÄúFunction - DATS_DAYS_BETWEEN‚Äù and apply the below mentioned formula.
  • Then click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù.

The Formula we have applied to calculate the Payment Terms Days is Net Due Date MINUS Baseline Date.

Created Calculation Elements (Fields) for the report.

In the Element Properties Section, Maintain the Aggregation method as ‚ÄúNo Operation‚Äù for the created Payment Term Days & Overdue Days Fields to convert the field into calculated measure for creating the Aging Buckets in the Custom Analytical Query APP.

 

Step ‚Äì 9: Preview and Publish the created CDS view

In the Log section, check any error need to rectified before preview the CDS view.

Click on ‚ÄúPreview Data‚Äù button to display the values are coming as per the logic or not.

 

Created CDS View no of line items are matching with the Manage Customer Line Items.

Calculated Fields (Overdue Days, Payment Terms Days) are displaying with values in the CDS View according formula we have applied in the calculation function.

Once Check is successful, Go to ‚ÄúNext Steps‚Äù section.

Click on ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù button to publish the Created CDS View for Creating Analytical Queries.

In Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

entry.title: SAP gives error message "No automated rule is activated in the system."
entry.content:
Spoiler
 

Hi experts! 

I'm trying to use this (for us) new application "Manage processing Rules -For Bank statements" and have created manually and automated rules. The automated rule has been activated and has status "Active" in the application. But when I'm in the application "Reprocess bank statement items" and trying to apply the automated rule SAP gives us the error "Items could not be processed. No automated rule is activated in the system." The automated rules are not being applied when uploading a bank statement, even when the correct conditions are met.

The manual rule is working without any problems. 

System:

Product Version
SAP S/4HANA 2023
SAP S/4HANA FOUNDATION 2023
SAP FIORI FES 2023 FOR S/4HANA
SAP FIORI FOR SAP S/4HANA 2023
ABAP PLATFORM 2023

entry.title: Developing a Customized AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Part 2
entry.content:
In this Part - 2, we'll dive into using the Custom Analytical Queries APP with our newly created Custom CDS View to build an AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Please refer Part - 1 to Understand the Custom CDS View created for the AR Aging Analysis Report:

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/developing-a-customized-ar-aging-analysis-report-in-sap-s-4hana-public/qaq-p/14163727

 

Custom Analytical Queries APP:

The Custom Analytical Queries APP is like a smart tool that helps you create your own reports and analyze your business data, even if you're not a tech expert.

Imagine you're trying to build your Customer Aging Analysis Report. Instead of writing complex computer code, this app takes all the raw numbers and information (like invoices, payments, and dates) and turns them into an easy-to-understand table or grid. It hides all the difficult technical stuff, so you just focus on what you want to see.

Here's how it helps you design your report:

Pick and choose your data: The app provides all the available fields from the business transactions. For your aging report, you'd select fields like Customer Name, Invoice Number, Posting Date, Due Date, Amount Due, and Clearing Date.

Filter what you see: You can set filters to narrow down your report. For example, you might filter to see only particular customers, or invoices past their due date by more than 365 days.

Create custom calculations: You can add restricted measures (like "Total Overdue Amount for 30-60 Days").

See results instantly: You can preview your report as you build it, so you know exactly what the final output will look like.

 

Step ‚Äì 1: Open the APP ‚Äì Custom Analytical Queries

Click on ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù button.

 

Enter the ‚ÄúQuery Name‚Äù, Choose the ‚ÄúData Source‚Äù ‚Äì which we have created as a CDS View.

Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

 

Step ‚Äì 2: Name the Analytical Query

In the General Tab,

Enter the ‚ÄúLabel‚Äù for the AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query and Click on Next Tab ‚ÄúField Selection‚Äù.

 

Step ‚Äì 3: Field Selection for the Analytical Query

In the Field Selection Tab,

Choose the required fields from the Available Fields by selecting the ‚ÄúCheck box‚Äù to display in the AR Aging Report.

 

Step ‚Äì 4: Arrange the Selected Fields in the Analytical Query

In the Display Tab,

Select relevant Field and Choose the ‚ÄúAxis‚Äù - Row / Column. Once selected the Axis, the field will be automatically moved to Row / Column Tab same as Company Code, Customer etc.

Note: Arrange the fields according to the business format and also Amounts / Numerical / Calculation related fields are arranged under the Measure Structure of Column Axis.

 

Step ‚Äì 5: Choose the Input Parameter Fields for the Report

For the AR Aging Analysis Report, users need to provide input parameters such as Open Items at Key Date, Customer, Company Code, GL Account, and Posting Date to generate the report based on their selections.

In the Filter Tab,

Choose the respective Field and then Select the radio button ‚ÄúUset Input Values‚Äù.

Select the ‚ÄúDefault Value‚Äù if required.

Note: Our AR Aging Analysis report runs based on the Open Items at Key Date, showing all items not cleared by that date. If you need to pre-fill any input fields, you can use the Default Value functionality in the filter section.

For Example: Below are the selected Input Parameters for our report and the ‚ÄúOpen Items at Key Date‚Äù and ‚ÄúCompany Code‚Äù will be defaulted at the time of report execution based on the settings in Analytical Queries.

Step ‚Äì 6: Create Calculated Measure Fields (Aging Buckets) for the Report

Creating Aging Buckets is the most challenging aspect of developing the AR Aging Analysis Report. This is primarily due to the complexity of applying the necessary formulas. To build custom aging buckets, you'll need a foundational understanding of IF & Else conditions, similar to those used in Excel, to grasp the CASE WHEN Expression formulas utilized in SAP Analytical Queries.

 

  1. Not Yet Due (Aging Bucket - 1)

In the Display Tab,

Click on ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù button and Choose ‚ÄúAdd Calculated Measure‚Äù to create the Aging Bucket.

Then Enter the ‚ÄúLabel‚Äù and Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

We've now added a "Not Yet Due" field to the query. This field displays the Amount in Company Code Currency for any customer open items with Overdue Days less than or equal to zero.

The above logic has been applied in the analytical query using the CASE WHEN formula.

In the Expression Section,

Choose the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button to apply the formula.

Select the ‚ÄúFunction‚Äù button then Choose the ‚ÄúCase Expression‚Äù and Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù button.

The formula applied in this ‚ÄúNot Yet Due‚Äù field is, if the Overdue days field is less than or equal to ‚Äú0‚Äù then ‚ÄúAmount in Company Code Currency‚Äù should be displayed in the report or Else the value should be displayed as ‚Äú0‚Äù. You can Choose the Measure fields by click on measures button or else you can type relevant measure field in the Expression editor. Once formula applied the Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

 

  1. 1 to 30 Days (Aging Bucket ‚Äì 2)

Apply the same steps involved in Not Yet Due field, only the formula will be changed for this 1 to 30 Days Aging Bucket.

For the "1 to 30 Days" field, we've applied a specific formula:

If a Customer Open item's Overdue Days are greater than or equal to "1" AND less than or equal to "30," the Amount in Company Code Currency will be displayed. Otherwise, the value will show as "0." This formula uses an AND condition to accurately identify customer open items that are between 1 and 30 days overdue.

After applying the formula, simply click "OK."

 You can apply this formula and change the conditions according to the Aging Buckets (31 to 60 Days, 61 to 90 Days‚Ä¶etc).

The Sum of all the Aging Buckets from ‚Äú1 to 30 Days till Above 365 Days‚Äù will be the ‚ÄúTotal Overdue Amount‚Äù.

Once the respective fields created in the Custom Analytical Queries APP.

Click on ‚ÄúSave Draft‚Äù the changes will be saved. Then click on ‚ÄúPreview‚Äù option to validate the report values.

 

Step ‚Äì 7: Preview and Validate the Created Custom Analytical Query

In the Input Parameters, The Open Items at Key Date and Company Code will automatically default the value according to the settings in Custom Analytical Queries APP and also it can be changeable at the time of report executing.

Once maintained the Input Parameters, Click on ‚ÄúGO‚Äù.

You can validate the output of the report in the Preview. So, the issues will be identified and resolved before publishing the Custom Analytical Query for the APP creation.

 

Step ‚Äì 8: Publish the Created Custom Analytical Query for AR Aging Analysis Report

Click on ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù to publish the created Custom Analytical Query for the AR Aging Analysis Report APP creation.

 

View Browser APP:

For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition key users, the View Browser app is essential for finding CDS views. This includes both SAP-released and custom CDS views.

The app provides a comprehensive list of available CDS views. You can see details like Category, View Types, Dimensions and Measures, Annotations, supported capabilities, and modelling patterns. It also offers robust search options. You can search by descriptions, application components, or even the tables used to build the CDS views.

Beyond searching, you can use the View Browser to analyze a CDS view's data fields. The application displays all CDS views and their underlying artifacts in tables. By default, views are organized by name, but you can also filter column values using a dropdown.

While you can't change SAP-created CDS views in the View Browser, the Custom Analytical Query app allows you to create, save, modify, and publish your own CDS views to catalogs.

 

Step ‚Äì 1: Create the Application for Created Custom Analytical Query

Open the ‚ÄúView Browser‚Äù APP.

Search the Created AR Aging Analysis Analytical Query in the Search Bar and then Click on the respective Analytical Query to Create the Application.

You can check the Fields, and CDS View involved in this Analytical Query.

Click on ‚ÄúCreate Application‚Äù.

Choose the ‚ÄúLanguage‚Äù

Enter the ‚ÄúTitle‚Äù and ‚ÄúSubtitle‚Äù for the Report and this will be the Application Name.

Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

Finally, the Application is created for the developed AR Aging Analysis Report.

 

Custom Catalog Extensions APP:

This app lets you assign your apps to specific business catalogs. After creating a new app, you must link it to the necessary catalogs. To use your new app, you'll need to assign a business role that includes that Catalog.

 

Step ‚Äì 1: Open the APP ‚Äì Custom Catalog Extensions

Select the Created Application to assign it to the respective Business Catalog.

 

Step ‚Äì 2: Assign Business Catalog to the Application

Click on ‚ÄúADD‚Äù.

 

Choose the respective ‚ÄúBusiness Catalog‚Äù and then Click on ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

Select the Business Catalog and then Click on ‚ÄúPublish‚Äù button.

Confirm by choosing the ‚ÄúOK‚Äù to publish.

Finally, the Created Application is assigned with the Business Catalog and published for the business usage.

 

Step ‚Äì 3: Display the APP - AR Aging Analysis ‚Äì Report

Once the APP is assigned with the Business Catalog, you can search the created APP in the search bar to display it for the reporting purpose.

Conclusion:

Developing a customized Customer AR Aging Analysis Report in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, as demonstrated, truly highlights the power and flexibility of "Key User Extensibility." While standard solutions offer a solid foundation, the ability to adapt and build tailored reports is crucial for meeting unique business requirements and ensuring user satisfaction.

By leveraging apps like Custom CDS Views, Custom Analytical Queries, the View Browser, and Custom Catalog Extensions, key users can effectively design and deploy robust financial reports without extensive technical coding. This empowers organizations to gain deeper insights into their financial data, streamline processes, and make more informed decisions regarding accounts receivable management.

This project was a testament to how SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition enables businesses to go beyond standard functionalities, proving that with the right tools and a clear understanding of business needs, powerful custom solutions are well within reach.

Thank You!
